subject: Ethics
title: Social License to Operate
description: A 60-second lesson on Social License to Operate.

hook.text: A mining company had every government permit. The local community blocked the road anyway. Operations halted.

buildup.text: Social license to operate means a community's informal acceptance that a company can do business there.

discovery.text: It's not a legal document. It's earned through trust, transparency, and genuine benefit to the community.

twist.text: Shell learned this in Nigeria. Legal permits meant nothing when local communities united against oil extraction.

climax.text: Companies that ignore social license face protests, boycotts, and delays that cost more than compliance ever would.

punchline.text: A permit comes from government. Permission comes from people.

quiz.question: What is a 'social license to operate'?
options: A community's informal acceptance that a company can operate in their area
A type of corporate insurance policy
